data.title: Highlighting Avenues to Reconcile Indigenous and Scientific Knowledge to Address Climate Change and Land Degradation in Lesotho: A Case Study of the Maseru District
data.meta_description: While indigenous knowledge (IK) has played an instrumental role in enabling sub-Saharan African farmers to adapt to changing environments for decades, it is often perceived as inferior to scientific knowledge. Hence, there is a need for comparisons between IK and...
